Theory of Machine Learning

Machine Learning Theory Group at Princeton

Blog About

Two Layer Neural Networks

Let $\theta = (W,a,b)$. Then we define the two layer neural network $f_\theta$ by:

\[f_\theta(x) := a^T \sigma(W x + b)\]

Expanding the Gradient

Because $f_{\theta}(x) \approx 0$ at initialization,

\[\begin{align*} \nabla_{w_j} L(\theta) &= a_jE_{x,y}[(f_\theta(x)-y)\sigma'(w_j \cdot x)x] \\ &\approx -a_j E_{x,y}[y\sigma'(w_j \cdot x)x] \end{align*}\]
